channel.title: FindText
channel.description:
Hello,
I am working on a script for a few of my clannies on a browser based game.
The colors are always the same and it should be easy to code with time.
What i'm having problems with is findtext and findtext at
Could you provide me some examples?
Like i want it to find the text then click it
Or are finding bitmaps better?
I'm looking to make this script as fast as possible please help.

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Yes, Janilabo’s procedure should work. You always have to but a begin and end after an if statement. The only exception to that would be this…
[scar]if(thisHappens) then break;[/scar]You don’t need a begin and end; on this because you’re only calling 1 procedure after the if statement. But its a good habit to always use begin’s and end;'s after if statements.

Read full topic

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

Mako, try if it works with… THIS:

[scar]procedure BorrowWeapons;
begin
ArmouryBmps;
if (weapon = 1) then
begin
findbitmap(lightdagger, x, y)
movemouse(x, y)
end;
if (weapon = 2) then
begin
findbitmap(darkhammer, x, y)
movemouse(x, y)
end;
if (weapon = 3) then
begin
findbitmap(darkbow, x, y)
movemouse(x, y)
end;
if (weapon = 4) then
begin
findbitmap(miracleaxe, x, y)
movemouse(x, y)
findbitmap(borrow, x1, y)
end;
end;[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Mako Mako
item.description:
@Mako wrote:

How would i make the procedure do only one?
Like when i say weapon =3 it still executes 1 2 then 3

I only want it executing If(weapon=3)then

[code]Procedure BorrowWeapons;
begin
ArmouryBmps;

If(weapon=1)Then
findbitmap(lightdagger,x,y)
movemouse(x,y)

If(weapon=2)Then
FindbitMap(darkhammer,x,y)
Movemouse(x,y)

If(weapon=3)Then
FindbitMap(darkbow,x,y)
Movemouse(x,y)

If(weapon=4)Then
FindbitMap(miracleaxe,x,y)
Movemouse(x,y)
Findbitmap(borrow,x1,y)
end;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

To unload the bitmaps, you’d use freeBitmap(bitmapName); on all of the bitmaps you wish to unload after you’ve used them.

A progress report is a little more complicated, what are you wanting to report when using this script? If the bitmap is found? I’ll go see if I can make a template for you real quick.

EDIT: Sorry, I have to go to bed, I’ll be back tomorrow.

Read full topic

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Mako Mako
item.description:
@Mako wrote:

Ok also how would i unload the bitmaps when im done?

Say all bitmaps from one single procedure?

Also how would i do say a progress report?

Read full topic

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Well, I believe findText uses CreateBitmapMaskFromText, so either way you’re gonna be using bitmaps, so I suggest using regular bitmaps for the sake of simplicity, so long the background behind the text never changes, then you should be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Mako Mako
item.description:
@Mako wrote:

Arent bitmaps slower then say findtext?

Read full topic

item.title: FindText
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

If the text and color never changes, I suggest using bitmaps mainly because they’d probably be easier. If you have problems with bitmaps, just reply here and I’ll see if I can help with findText.

Read full topic
